attributes.action: Re-evaluate the Council House Programme
attributes.background: We need to re-evaluate the Council House Programme as Council houses should only be available to those in desperate need of local support and/or because they are facing homelessness (as long as they haven't made themselves intentionally homeless)
attributes.additional_details: Council houses should only be available to those in desperate need of local support and/or because they're facing homelessness and then when they're back on their feet and are able to afford to either private rent or get a mortgage, the council should assist them with this, & then this council house can then be made available again for those who really need it. (Also need a large nationwide building programme to reimburse the council House stock, & until then the Right To Buy should be stopped)

attributes.action: Advise Monarch to exercise the prerogative of mercy for Charles Bronson.
attributes.background: We would like the government to approach and advise the Monarch to exercise the prerogative of mercy for Micheal Peterson AKA Charles Bronson. As I'm sure you know this man has spent 40+ years in prison,although this man may have done wrong in the past this is excessive.
attributes.additional_details: The sentence is excessive for anyone let alone someone who has never murdered anyone, he has spent a good 80% of his sentence in solitary confinement. This man has served more then his fare share of prison time and should be released immediately. There is no question he may not have been an role model prisoner in the past, but just a simple Internet search will reveal that this man is reformed and draws and sells on his artwork for many charities.

attributes.action: British & European Citizenship for those who wish to remain a part of Europe.
attributes.background: Given that there is precedent for dual nationality in N.Ireland I feel it is only fair, and morally right, that as just under half of the country didn't want to leave the EU that those who wish to stay should have the option to keep European citizenship when Brexit negotiations begin.
attributes.additional_details:
I was born in N.Ireland and as I grew up I was told I was N.Irish, Irish, British and European. I had a choice on who I affiliated myself with and I had a choice to be a part of something smaller, or something bigger; I chose the latter.

It is therefore, with precedent and just under half the country having voted to remain, that the government should not ignore what is a large minority and give everyone the rights that others in these islands already have.

Choice on citizenship!

attributes.action: Remove the powers local authorities have to switch off street lights at  night.
attributes.background: Several authorities have switched off street lights at night, regardless of possible crime and safety consequences. The latest is Surrey County Council, to save £210,000 a year, a mere pittance in relative terms, and an amount that could surely be saved by, for example, axing the Chief Exec post.

attributes.action: All new public transport buses to be either electric or hydrogen fuel by 2018.
attributes.background: Health campaigners say Britain is facing an “air pollution crisis”.  It is estimated that the lives of 40,000 to 50,000 people in the UK are ended prematurely every year.  Yet technology exists to solve this problem.  By introducing new zero emission buses, dirty diesel buses will be phased out.

attributes.action: Double the free child care hours for working parents or single working parent.
attributes.background:
More than one in four UK business leaders say employees have cut their hours because of the "high cost of childcare", a report from the British Chambers of Commerce says.

The government wants to have a lower unemployment rate, so they should consider things like this.
attributes.additional_details: UK jobless rate declined to 4.8 percent in the three months to September 2016 from 4.9 percent in the April to June period and 5.3 percent a year earlier. This could be changed if they helped us with child care costs!

attributes.action: Insurance for cyclists
attributes.background: Cyclists use the road on a day to day basis. If they use the road, they should have to pay for it like we do. If they crash into your car causing damage, you end up footing the cost and losing your No Claims Bonus. They should have their own insurance for using the road.
attributes.additional_details: A car is damaged by a cyclists cycling without due care and attention, who has to pay for the damage? You do through your insurance which has a great affect on you. If that was a car, their insurance would pay so therefore cyclists should be treated the same and have to have insurance to cover themselves. This also means obeying the rules of the road such as stopping at red-lights and not using bus lanes.

attributes.action: Create a single Bullying Law that applies to all Schools in England
attributes.background: Schools are letting pupils down by not taking Bullying seriously and ignoring their policies. There needs to be a Law on Bullying that all Schools have to abide by. There are Children taking their own lives and i feel this would stop if there was a law that made schools help.
attributes.additional_details: News Articles. My own experience with my Child. I have spoken to numerous other Parents about their experiences too

attributes.action: Establish a list of acredited Business Consultants/Mentor organisations.
attributes.background: Business Consultants offer valuable advice to government and SMEs yet remain unregulated.  It is proposed that when engaging, recommending, or working with Business Consultants government bodies and SMEs should be able to refer to an approved provider list of organisations and agencies.
attributes.additional_details: SMEs are seen as the growth engine of the economy yet there is little information for the inexperienced to identify who are credible business consultants and who are not.  There is no overarching governance mechanism, and yet we see numerous initiatives and grants seeking to help this sector. To this extent making available a list of accrediting organisations who exercise not only a quality control scheme for their members but ongoing educational programmes, for example as offered by, the Association of Business Mentor (a body of professional mentors) or such organisations as ibd Business Advice Group (ibd-uk.com – a group of business consultants) would protect both end user and provider.

attributes.action: Make the 5p bag charge go towards the NHS.
attributes.background: I think a better use for the 5p bag charge will be to donate the money to our crippled NHS .

attributes.action: Put in place aid stations across the UK where the homeless can have hot food.
attributes.background: It is shameful that in 2017 people are living on the streets with very little support.  I want a concerted effort,  Multi agency,  To eradicate this to the history books including access to medical help and basic hygiene facilities.

attributes.action: Introduce paid bereavement leave as an employment right
attributes.background:
Losing a loved one is traumatic, stressful & demanding, but there is no legal requirement for employers to provide paid bereavement leave.

This means employers can force people to immediately return to work or go unpaid/use their holiday, which is unacceptable & counter-productive for well-being.
attributes.additional_details:
With the news that Facebook allows 20 days bereavement leave (http://bbc.in/2kYZd1J), I'm reminded of when my mother died and I was forced to use my holiday entitlement to grieve and take care of practical matters.

Media coverage shows I'm not alone in experiencing this (http://bbc.in/1gGBED7) and it highlights a dire lack of protection for workers' mental well-being, which should be a main consideration of the state and employers.

I suggest a min. 5 days paid leave. Small businesses exempt.

attributes.action: Cap energy prices so that families do not struggle to keep their homes warm.
attributes.background: The Big Six energy firms are profiteering from ripping off British Customers. They should be held accountable for putting families such as those on benefits in to fuel poverty, especially when the winters are getting colder.

attributes.action: Bring an end to Fast Track Fitness Instructor/Personal Trainer courses
attributes.background:
Training providers who offer you a chance to call yourself a Fitness Professional after a few days need to be stopped.
If these companies are not stopped the standard of Fitness Instructors will keep dropping while the obesity rate gets higher.
Call Full Enquiry into the awarding bodies
attributes.additional_details:
here is an example of types of courses that need to be stopped


https://focus-training.com/courses/full-time-gym-instructor-courses/

If you would like to join discusson on this subject my facebok group is ''Fitness Professionals Association''.

attributes.action: Introduce stricter air pollution laws in the uk eg. stronger fines.
attributes.background: This year 24 areas in London reached the highest recorded levels of pollution in 5 years. This also happened in several areas in Western Europe effecting people with breathing disabilities. We need to lead in environmental issues as we have great influence. This will prompt other countries to follow
attributes.additional_details: The information is a reference to the observers article on pollution, published on the 29th January 2017 (Sunday) titled: Smog In the cities: the truth about Britain's dirty air.

attributes.action: Brain scans for anyone entering  hospital with head injurys as protocol
attributes.background: When a person has an injury to their head the damage isn't always visible so let's spread the word to get brain scans offered as protocol to anyone entering the hospital with a head injury.
attributes.additional_details: Please help brain injuries get noticed quicker and before it totally changes a family's life by signing this petition, as recently a friend of mine lost their son due to a head injury which he was admitted to hospital with the staff stitched his head and discharged him hours later he was rushed in as collapsed and ended up in a

attributes.action: Make PTSD a recognised illness for fair claim and recognition of PIP at DWP.
attributes.background: I would like the government to re-address the level of illness, disability and point scoring of PIP claims for PTSD. British people need fair claim for the illness that is debilitating and get the help in such times of need. There is apparent great need for this within the ex-services community.
attributes.additional_details: I tried claiming PIP on the encouragement of my social worker before medical discharg for PTSD. Following the interview for PIP, which was distresssing enough, I was given zero points, even though on the letter I received it stateded I obviously had some form of mental illness at this time. I could get nothing as it's not classed as a health condition or disability. I am well now but would have benefitted from the extra income, as I was unable to do many activitys of daily living due to my PTSD.

attributes.action: Take action to make victims feel more able to report sexual violence.
attributes.background: According to "An overview of Sexual Offending"(Jan 2013) 57% of women who have been raped told someone but not the police, 28% told no one. More must be done to ensure that victims feel able to report incidents and be taken seriously. I suggest closer collaboration with charities such as rape crisis
attributes.additional_details:
See "An Overview of Sexual Offendinf in England and Wales" (Ministry of Justice, Home Office &a Office for National Statistics) for more general statistics. 
I submit this petition in the hope that it will prompt wider debate about the way in which sexual violence is treated within the criminal justice system and how victims are treated.

attributes.action: Can you make funding available to GB Baseball & Softball for the 2020 Olympics?
attributes.background: With the announcement by the Olympic Organisation Committee, the sports of Baseball and Softball will be reinstated at the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo, Japan. There is over 21,000 people, youth, adult, females and males registered with the BBF & BSF and British Baseball Softball United Kingdom, who play.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a wonderful Baseball/Softball  Complex at Farnham Park, Slough. Where the games of both sports are held/played throughout the summer months.
There is also the governing bodies for Baseball and Softball.
The British Baseball Federation for baseball. (BBF)
The British Softball Federation. (BSF)
The British Baseball Softball United Kingdom. (BSUK)
The BSUK is the development  group for British Baseball and Softball.

attributes.action: Amend the Care Act (s73) 2014 which fails to protect private paying patients
attributes.background: I was booked for elective day surgery in a Private Hospital but unfortunately, the device was placed incorrectly that has resulted in horrendous physical injuries. The Private Hospital is not liable and the Surgeon denied misplacement that was not discovered until years later.
attributes.additional_details: No tests were offered to ascertain if the device was displaced as I had this surgical procedure privately. I had to vigorously research what tests were needed to identify misplacement and I eventually learnt that a volume and gadolinium MRI would be the only source. These tests were eventually done after much persistence that finally illustrated incorrect placement that has caused me physical injuries and lost career. Members of the public are under the assumption that private paying patients will always be protected but the Care Act 2014 has never protected this category of patients; this Act needs amending to ensure  all of the public are protected irrespective of fee source.

attributes.action: A legal aid framework for victims in the case of IVP dataset compromises.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Bill requires the creation of huge datasets of citizens online activity. These datasets will be a very tempting target for criminals. The Government should create a legal aid framework that will help any victims in the case of these datasets being compromised.
attributes.additional_details: We realise that as much attention to security will be given as possible in terms of protecting the hardware and the software protecting this data. This does not mean however that a compromise is not possible and attention needs to be given to what will happen in the event of a compromise and what aid can be given to victims. The framework for this aid should be discussed and a framework formalised in advance so that it is clear to each citizen what help and redress they may seek.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for shops to tell customers that they sell real fur
attributes.background: Many people believe that the fur industry is a thing of the past and is no longer 'fashionable,' however this is far from the truth. While it has been illegal since 2002 to farm animals for fur in the UK, it is still able to be imported, making it a £500 million industry in the UK every year.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.animalaid.org.uk/images/pdf/factfiles/fur.pdf

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/11/25/faux-fur-or-real_n_8648146.html

http://www.peta.org.uk/issues/animals-not-wear/fur-trade/

attributes.action: Preserve the UK bat population by banning wind farms
attributes.background: All species of UK bats are protected by the law. Wind farms are killing thousands of them each year.Bats have been around for 30 million years able to fly without the risk of colliding with spinning objects. They deactivate their sonar when near turbines and are attracted to the bugs drawn to them.
attributes.additional_details:
At 29 of the 46 UK wind farms examined 194 were killed monthly- a likely gross underestimate. Carried over to the 6,954 onshore turbines the carnage is tens of thousands.
Dr Lintott suggests turning off turbines during high risk periods. 
On October 2016 227 megawatts (just 0.6% of the 36,759 mW being used) was from turbines, 70%from coal; 21% nuclear; 8% from abroad.
We need forms of reliable renewable energy to deliver electricity at competitive prices that do not devastate the bat population.

attributes.action: Debate whether self-regulation of the press is adequate.
attributes.background: The UK press is constantly coming under fire for misrepresenting stories and misleading the public with inflammatory opinion pieces that purport to be news items.
attributes.additional_details:
“the press is given significant and special rights in this country ... With these rights, however, come responsibilities to the public interest: to respect the truth, to obey the law and to uphold the rights and liberties of individuals. In short, to honour the very principles proclaimed and articulated by the industry itself (and to a large degree reflected in the Editors’ Code of Practice)”.
- Sir Brian Leveson

Some newspapers are clearly failing to 'respect the truth'.

attributes.action: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.
attributes.background: We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom. As well as how unfairly Scotland is treated buy the rest of the UK they seem to forget about all the English money that is used to help and support Scotland. So i propose we have a show of hands to see how many people in the rest of the UK would want to become separated from Scotland. I think that Scotland would be shocked at the result of this partition

attributes.action: Build new runways at Heathrow and Gatwick to future proof UK airport capacity
attributes.background: Heathrow often runs at 98% capcity, and is the busiest two runway airport in the world.  Likewise Gatwick is the busiest single runway airport in the world.  The capacity is long overdue, and planes are circling both hubs emitting more CO2 than necessary. Build both runways as soon as possible.
attributes.additional_details:
Gatwick has the world's busiest single-use runway. It does have two runways on site but the close proximity of the two and the length and lack of guidance for the second means that only one is used. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World%27s_busiest_airport#Busiest_airports
The plan to expand Heathrow was supported by businesses, the aviation industry, the British Chambers of Commerce, the Confederation of British Industry, the Trades Union Congress and the then Labour government. 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heathrow_Airport
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-37566361

attributes.action: No Trump UK state visit until apology issued on false wiretapping allegation.
attributes.background: Trump allegations against GCHQ remain unsubstantiated. UK Foreign Secretary should press for a full public apology from Trump.

attributes.action: Make it a specific criminal offence for attacking staff within the hospitals
attributes.background: The NHS staff and the employees of the NHS partner companies are often threatened and attacked within the hospitals by visitors or the patients themselves. I would like to start this petition as stronger measures should be taken against it by the authorities and be made a specific criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details: Apart from the NHS staff, the cleaners, car park attendants and security officers are also often attacked by the members of public, patients and the relatives of the patients. The NHS contractors also contribute towards the well-being of the patients as they also have duty of care but if they are attacked, the prosecution is usually very week and the offenders get away with it and can do it again, so in light of this, we urge you to take tougher actions and make it a specific criminal offence.

attributes.action: Introduce 100% Inheritance Tax At £10 Million
attributes.background: Don’t you wish to see the gap between the ultra-rich and the poor begin to narrow, instead of constantly widening? How can we even begin creating an even playing field where equal opportunity exists for everyone, while the colossal gap between privilege and poverty stares us in the face every day?
attributes.additional_details:
If no-one could pass on more than £10 million total to be divided between their heirs, we would see the gap between the rich and poor begin to narrow for the first time. 

A New Graded System could look like this :
40% IT payable after £750,000
50% IT payable after £1 million
60% IT payable after £2. 5 million
70% IT payable after £5 million
85% IT payable after £7. 5 million
100% IT payable after £10 million

100% IT could help properly fund the NHS, Education, Housing, Etc…  Please support it!

attributes.action: Outlaw anti-abortion campaigns near health centres
attributes.background:
Blown-up, graphic images of abortion, and threats to film people attending BPAS surgeries are likely to scare vulnerable people away from the one place they could get state-sanctioned, impartial advice and assistance.

People have a right to express their views but not in a way that harms others.
attributes.additional_details:
It is well-documented that providing safe, non-judgemental access to health and family planning advice leads to an overall decrease in sexual-health related problems. Aggressive campaigning denies that access. 

Victims of abuse or rape, those who are unsure how to cope with pregnancy, contraceptives or sexual health issues might go away in fear then fail to seek help at all -  disastrous for the victims, and likely to create long-lasting problems for their families and social care services.

attributes.action: Make it a specific offence to cause distress or hatred to rough sleepers.
attributes.background: A student from one of the world's top universities (the University of Cambridge) has been caught on camera setting fire to a £20 note in front of a freezing homeless person. This sort of behavoiur is unacceptable in a civilized society and should be dealt with swiftly by the police.
attributes.additional_details: It has been rumoured that burning a £50 note in front of a homeless person is one of the initiation ceremonies of Oxford's notorious Bullingdon club.

attributes.action: Create CPOs for all derelict properties to house veterans.
attributes.background: We want more Social Housing in the UK. Priority given to those who fought for our freedom. They are, some of them, suffering from PTSD and not so far from danger.
attributes.additional_details: We also want to make sales of MoD land for development conditional on providing housing for ex military personnel.

attributes.action: Regulate locksmithing in the UK
attributes.background: In the UK any one can trade as a locksmith. This means that the person you get to secure your property may not know the standards that are associated with the industry. It is time that this crucial trade is regulated to stop scam locksmiths from operating.
attributes.additional_details: At this time there are several trade associations operating in the UK.  We need to be clear on one operating body that can regulate, vet and ensure that those who trade in this sector are of a minimum standard. This would help to eliminate poor standards of craftsmanship and ensure better security throughout the Uk

attributes.action: Give more funding into the research of mental health especially anxiety.
attributes.background: People go undiagnosed or even wrongly diagnosed with anxiety and depression every day in the UK. We need more funding into the research and better treatments. I would also like potential financial support for those with anxiety who cannot work.

attributes.action: Change the age to 25 for the sale of Fireworks
attributes.background: If the law was to change to make it illegal to sell to anyone under 25, I'm confident the constant noise on non celebrating days (Fireworks nt, Diwali & New Year's Eve) would dwindle away. Fireworks started 22/10 until 10/12 & back again 24/12 in Dagenham. They're a nuisance especially to Pets.
attributes.additional_details:
How many reports have we seen this year alone about children being injured by other children launching fireworks at them? As usual to many.
Why are supermarkets allowed to advertise "sales" on Fireworks from 7/11/16? 
In this day & age why can't fireworks be made to make minimal noise?

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for Parkinsons sufferers
attributes.background: Cannabis relieves Parkinsons symptoms and dyskinesia caused by Parkinsons drugs

attributes.action: Terminate the tax free benefits enjoyed by religious institutions.
attributes.background:
Churches, mosques and synagogues don't pay any tax on earnings or land owned, yet they often preach about social responsibility.
To really help the local communities in which they thrive they should give something back in the form of taxes.
attributes.additional_details:
In light of the fact we are rapidly moving toward a more secular society, why should we still be subsidising religion via tax exemption?
The church often takes a political stance during times of crisis. Most recently the humanitarian disaster that is the refugee exodus, has the church not got a moral responsibility to contribute some of its vast wealth? Now lets make it a legal one too.

attributes.action: Businesses must close their doors, if they have to put their heating on.
attributes.background:
Its time to create a law that all businesses must close their doors, if they have to put their heating on. 
If everyone does it we can beat the myth that open doors in winter are welcoming, and we can do our part to cut our heating bills and contribute to saving the environment at the same time.

attributes.action: NHS - Give more support to Young Adults
attributes.background: It is extremely worrying & stressful for anyone going to hospital, it is even worse for any young adult (aged 16-20) as whenever you go to clinic, operation or getting a referral done it is extremely difficult, as no one knows where to put you as technically you are too old for children's, but...
attributes.additional_details: ... but are also too young to be in the adults. This is worse when you become an inpatient and they don't know which ward to put you on, and neither is ideal. You spend long periods of uncertainty being passed from departments and you are just waiting for someone to give you the help & support you desperately need. This is a petition for the NHS to give more support and structure within the NHS for Young Adults, (one way do to this would be to introduce specific young adult clinics and wards)

attributes.action: Make physical appearance a protected characteristic.
attributes.background: People feel victimised by an unjust decision to restrict their identity. Having their own hair style and colour makes people feel more comfortable in society, this can make people feel more comfortable with themselves. This should be accepted to give everyone an equal opportunity to be themselves.
attributes.additional_details: In schools, teachers try to dictate hair colour and style. Article 10 of the Human Rights Act states that students should be able to express themselves and make them feel identified without the interference from the authority (teachers being the authority in schools). Also, the same idea applies in article 14. This article was created to try and allow everyone to have equal opportunities for something they may otherwise be judged upon. So why doesn't Article 14 protect physical appearance? All other protected characteristics are things that make people feel more accepted in society because in the past they were not as widely accepted. People should not change the way they look from a style that makes them feel comfortable with themselves, so don't make them.

attributes.action: Not new grammar schools, put the funding into high achieving comprehensives.
attributes.background: In September, PM Theresa May announced the government's plans to reintroduce selective state education in the form of grammar schools. Students are selected by 11+ exams, not the age to be determining the schooling for the next 7 years. The government should prioritise existing comprehensives.
attributes.additional_details: The Government want these schools to be allowed to be created once again. This was not what was voted for in the 2015 Conservative manifesto, David Cameron was highly against grammar schools. The money should go to the success that is comprehensive schools. Studies have shown that comprehensive students have fared better at university and they achieve, even with non selection, competitive grades, why should the government try to separate students rather than fund comprehensive schooling more?

attributes.action: Tax all products containing palm oil
attributes.background: The production of palm oil is a dangerous and environmentaly disastrous procedure. It produces vast quantities of CO2 as well as damaging local ecosystems and the worldwide environment. Place a tax on all products in the UK to reduce its sales.

attributes.action: Change the Bus Services Bill so authorities are allowed to set up bus companies.
attributes.background: We the undersigned object to section 21 (1) of the Bus Services Bill 2016 as it stops local authorities from having the freedom to form municipal bus companies and we want this clause erased from the final bill.
attributes.additional_details:
The bill can be viewed at http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/bills/lbill/2016-2017/0058/lbill_2016-20170058_en_1.htm

Authorities should have the ability to set up municipal bus companies. It is essential that councils have the power to best meet the transport needs of citizens, for example cities with Mayors should be allowed to follow the model laid out by Transport For London. 

Carefully considered, reliable and affordable public transport is essential to modern life.

attributes.action: Require all dogs to be on leads in public places
attributes.background: In public places, such as fields used for football or other things, dogs cause havoc by roaming free and urinating wherever they please whilst their owners turn a blind eye or claim that the dog won't hurt anyone. Sufficient excercise can be gained by walking with them on a lead

attributes.action: Prevent the sale of painkillers to children
attributes.background: I was unaware until recently that children under 16 could purchase painkillers. I had always assumed you had to be 16. My daughter had purchased paracetamols and took an overdose. Although she is alive an ok I want to prevent the sale of painkillers to under 16's.
attributes.additional_details: I enquired at many shops to see if they had any age restrictions on the sale of paracetamols some did but others did not. Studies show 1-3 children in the classroom are suffering from mental health issues or stress. Being able to purchase painkillers so easy no wonder so many children choose to overdose. My daughter spent 2 weeks in hospital and the amount of children who come in and taken an overdose was worrying. I know this won't stop them trying but we could make the sale less easy.

attributes.action: Introduce animal rights to the primary curriculum
attributes.background: All children need to be educated about sentient beings and how non human animals are capable of having the same senses as us. Every one feels pain,including all non human animals. Everyone feels love,pleasure,joy,loss,fear frustration and depression,including non human animals.
attributes.additional_details: To deny someone of their basic rights of freedom and life is morally wrong. To take away a life for reasons of greed and pleasure, for reasons of gain/profit is morally wrong. We have a moral obligation to teach children that killing all forms of sentient animals is wrong. Children need to have the choices of not wanting to eat,wear,or exploit those who rely on us for protection and defence. Children need to be taught all about the profit making industries who exploit and kill non human animals.

attributes.action: Change the law on sexual abuse in a position of trust to include sports clubs
attributes.background: I was concerned to find that the Sexual Offences Act 2003 doesn't include sports clubs as one of the settings in which the Act’s provisions on ‘abuse of position of trust’ apply. At the moment, the law doesn't protect 16 and 17 year olds from sexual harassment and abuse in sports clubs.

attributes.action: Give volunteers similar equality rights as employee's.
attributes.background: As a volunteer in the United Kingdom, an organisation is allowed to dismiss you without giving a reason or even on grounds of discrimination. Volunteers are the backbone of many communities in this country and I believe they should have the same rights as employee's not to be discriminated against.
attributes.additional_details:
As an employee, you have the right not to be discriminated against. If a company dismisses you and you believe they have discriminated in making this decision, you have the right to appeal to an employment tribunal.

As it stands, a volunteer could put in 30 years and if something changes with their circumstances, the organisation can dismiss them. I believe they should be able to appeal this decision to a similar tribunal and volunteering should be covered by all discrimination law.

attributes.action: Term Time Job Contracts for Parents
attributes.background: Term time jobs will allow thousands of parents to work and be at home with their children during school holidays. This should be accessible for parents with children aged 5-16
attributes.additional_details: Enforcing companies to employ a ratio of term time contracts dependant on staff numbers will allow parents to return to work and still take care of their children. This will get many people off of benefits and back into work. Many lone parents such as myself want to work but also want to be at home while our children are young to raise them and spend quality time with them. Students could be placed on temporary contracts during school holidays to fill the term time contractors.

attributes.action: Employers to have mandatory training on hearing impairment & its implications
attributes.background: Most people assume people hearing impaired from birth are fine when they have a hearing aid/s. A hearing aid does not improve someones ability when it comes to processing information. I believe that specific training would be useful to employers in explaining the cognitive process that is required.
attributes.additional_details: Employers don't seem to fully understand the difficulties that people born hearing impaired have when it comes to processing information. Some comments I have received have shown naivety bordering on ignorance. It shocks me how uneducated employers seem to be on a impairment which affects more than 11 million people in the UK. That's one in six of the population. By 2035, it is estimated there will be 15.6 million people with hearing loss in the UK. That's one in five.
